title: 820-2132 won't turn on without SMC bypass
message:
I know, I know, you guys are going to pound me for touching such an old piece of shit, but I've already spent 30+ hours on this, and I'm just itching out of personal curiosity to know what's going on with it. I have Green Light, S5 state, SMC_ONOFF_L, RSMRST_PWRGD, PM_PWRBTN_L, PM_SLP_S4_L, PM_SLP_S5_L and PM_RSMRST_L all in their correct voltages, and I've tried going in with refit and smcflasher in an efi shell, but it won't let me '-reset 1' or flash firmware on, also says it's in U mode not AppCode mode. Should I just conclude that the SMC is fucked and move on with my life? Or am I missing something.

Fun fact, I got a donor board hoping to use the SMC off of that, and it has the exact same issue. FML :confused:

title: 820-2132 won't turn on without SMC bypass
message: You are not using a 85W charger or a fake chinese one. That is why both boards act the same.

title: 820-2132 won't turn on without SMC bypass
message: God Dammit, I'm using a 60W, it's worked fine for every other newer machine... do these older macbook SMC's draw more current?

title: 820-2132 won't turn on without SMC bypass
message: Not older macbooks, all 15" and 17" only boot up with 85w charger...

title: 820-2132 won't turn on without SMC bypass
message: I'm not sure about all 17", but I've worked with dozens of 15" and they boot fine off of a 65 watt

title: 820-2132 won't turn on without SMC bypass
message: No 15 or 17" machine will run from anything less than 85W unless there is a battery connected with some charge in it.

title: 820-2132 won't turn on without SMC bypass
message: Ok, thanks for the info duke, I never knew that :)
